Japanese: 私はよくテレビを見ます。
English: I often watch TV.

Japanese: あした京都に行きます。
English: I will go to Kyoto tomorrow.

Japanese: コーヒーを飲みません。
English: I don't drink coffee.

Japanese: 図書館で本を読みます。
English: I read books in the library.

Japanese: うちで昼ごはんを食べます。
English: I eat lunch at home.

Japanese: 今日学校に行きません。
English: I don't go to school today.

Japanese: 日曜日に京都に行きます。
English: I will go to Kyoto on Sunday.

Japanese: 十一時ごろ寝ます。
English: I go to bed around 11 o'clock.

Japanese: 毎日、日本語を勉強します。
English: I study Japanese every day.

Japanese: あひた来ます。
English: I will come tomorrow.

Japanese: あさ本を読みます。
English: I read books in the morning.

Japanese: 週末、何をしますか。
English: What do you do on weekends?

Japanese: A(F):昼ごはんを食べませんか。￥B (M):いいですね。
English: A(F): Shall we have lunch?;;B(M): That's a good idea."

Japanese: A(F):今日、何をしますか。￥B(M):図書館で本を読みます。
English: A(F): What are you going to do today?;;B(M): I will read books in the library.

Japanese: A(M):テニスをしませんか。￥B(F):ううん、ちょっと。
English: A(F): Shall we play tennis?;;B(F):Um, it's a bit inconvenient

Japanese: ときどき、映画を見ます。
English: I sometimes watch movies.

Japanese: ぜんぜん図書館に行きません。
English: I never go to the library.

Japanese: 週末は、たいてい何をしますか。
English: What do you usually do on weekends?

Japanese: A(F):今日、何をしますか。￥B(M):図書館で本を読みます。
English: A(F): What are you going to do today?;;B(M): I will read books in the library.

Japanese: たけしさんは毎日日本語を勉強します。
English: Takeshi studies Japanese every day.

Japanese: A(M):こんばん映画を見ませんか。￥B(F):ううん、ちょっと。￥A (M):あしたどうですか。￥B(F):いいですね。
English: A(M): Shall we watch a movie tonight?;;B(F): Um, it's a bit inconvenient.;;A(M): How about tomorrow?;;B(F): That's a good idea.

Japanese: 私はよく6時に起きます
English: I often get up at 6 o'clock.

Japanese: 私は時々日本の新聞を読みます
English: I sometimes read Japanese newspapers.

Japanese: ユイさんはあまり食べません。
English: Yui doesn't eat much.
